content: nessie -the loch ness monster- version a-4 november 17 2006 materials needed -any heavy worsted weight yarn approx 1 oz i used peace fleece in mir-atlantis periwinkle i highly recommend this yarn as it is thick and sturdy -g hook or hook needed to obtain gauge -stuffing of your choice this can be wool roving polyester fiberfill fabric scraps of yarn…use your imagination -tapestry needle and stitch marker gauge 4 5 sts and 4 5 row per inch in single_crochet head round 1 chain 2 6 single_crochet in the 2nd chain from hook join w/ slip_stitch to 1st single_crochet made 6sc rnds 2-3 chain 1 single_crochet in ea st around join w/ slip_stitch stuff round 4 chain 1 single_crochet in next st single_crochet decrease around join w/ slip_stitch 4 single_crochet neck rnds 5-14 chain 1 single_crochet in each single_crochet around join w/ slip_stitch you do not need to stuff the neck the stitches are close enough together that there isn t space for stuffing and the neck should be stiff enough that it will stand on it s own this is why a heavy worsted weight yarn is important if you are using a finer weight yarn use a smaller hook size to achieve tighter stitches round 15 chain 1 single_crochet in next st 2 single_crochet in the next st around join w/ slip_stitch 6 single_crochet body round 16 chain 1 single_crochet in ea st around join w/ slip_stitch round 17 chain 1 single_crochet in next 2 sts 2 single_crochet in the next st around join w/ slip_stitch 8 single_crochet round 18 chain 1 single_crochet in next 3 sts 2 single_crochet in the next st around join w/
